definition: to lose one's virginity/to lose one's chastity
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: You would not expect him actually to perform those degrading acts?
sentences.chinese: 你并不指望他真的干出这些有失身份的事？

sentences.english: I hope you wouldn't lower yourself to cheat in the examination.
sentences.chinese: 希望你考试不要作弊，别做有失身份的事。

sentences.english: It is beneath him to grumble.
He also hears quite often from women concerned about losing their virginity to Mr. Wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他还经常听说女人们很担心失身给错误的人。

sentences.english: It would be beneath your dignity if you really do this.
sentences.chinese: 你要是真的这么做的话就有失身份了。

sentences.english: He considers love that jobs beneath he.
sentences.chinese: 他以为做那样的任务有失身份。

sentences.english: If you wear like that you will look cheap.
sentences.chinese: 要是穿成那样，你看起来挺有失身份的。

sentences.english: Monica: Wow. My brother never even told me when he lost his virginity.
sentences.chinese: 哇，我哥从来没告诉我，他什么时候失身的。

sentences.english: He considered the job beneath his dignity.
sentences.chinese: 他认为这种工作有失身份。

definition: early evening/wedding night/(fig.) first sexual encounter
to keep oneself pure/to preserve one's integrity/to remain chaste
to be disloyal (to one's country, spouse etc)/to lose one's chastity
to flee to avoid an arranged marriage
to break the hymen/to lose virginity
to have sexual relations with sb/to have dealings with
to force oneself upon sb (idiom)/to rape
to drug and then rape sb
